data.text:
Cards From Mary Evans Picture Library

Carl Spitteler / Nobel 19

CARL SPITTELER pseudonym CARL FELIX TANDEM Swiss writer

Mary Evans Picture Library makes available wonderful images created for people to enjoy over the centuries

1845 Carl Felix Nobel Pseudonym Swiss Tandem 1924

Greetings Card (7"x5")

Introducing the elegant and thought-provoking range of greeting cards from Media Storehouse, featuring the captivating image "Carl Spitteler / Nobel 19" by Mary Evans Picture Library from Mary Evans Prints Online. This exquisite design showcases the enigmatic Swiss writer, Carl Spitteler, who authored the Nobel Prize-winning work "Olympic Odes" under his pseudonym Carl Felix Tandem. These sophisticated cards are perfect for expressing deep feelings and thoughtful sentiments. Each card is printed on high-quality paper and comes with a white envelope, making them a delightful addition to any correspondence. Delight your loved ones with the timeless beauty of literature and art combined in these unique and beautifully designed greeting cards.

Folded Greeting Cards (12.5x17.5 cm) have a laminate finish and are supplied with an envelope. The front and inside can be personalised with text in a selection of fonts, layouts and colours.

Greetings Cards suitable for Birthdays, Weddings, Anniversaries, Graduations, Thank You and much more

Estimated Product Size is 17.5cm x 12.5cm (6.9" x 4.9")

These are individually made so all sizes are approximate

Artwork printed orientated as per the preview above, with landscape (horizontal) or portrait (vertical) orientation to match the source image.

EDITORS COMMENTS

This print captures the esteemed Swiss writer Carl Spitteler, known for his exceptional literary contributions and recipient of the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1919. With a distinguished white beard and a warm smile, Spitteler exudes wisdom and charm as he gazes into the camera lens. Born in 1845 as Carl Felix Tandem, he adopted the pseudonym Carl Spitteler under which he would achieve great acclaim for his works. Throughout his illustrious career, Spitteler delved into various genres including poetry, prose, and drama, leaving an indelible mark on Swiss literature. His writing often explored themes of human nature, spirituality, and existentialism with profound insight and depth. By winning the prestigious Nobel Prize in Literature in 1919, Spitteler solidified his status as one of Switzerland's most celebrated literary figures. As we admire this historical portrait of Carl Spitteler captured by Mary Evans Picture Library, we are reminded of his enduring legacy that continues to inspire readers and writers alike. The image not only serves as a visual representation of a remarkable individual but also encapsulates a moment frozen in time - a glimpse into the life of a brilliant mind whose words have left an everlasting impact on generations to come.
